title: Analysis of f from Taylor Polynomial part - b

content.description: Let P(x)=7−3(x−4)+5(x−4)2−2(x−4)3+6(x−4)4 be the fourth-degree Taylor polynomial for the function f about 4. Assume f has derivatives of all orders for all real numbers.
content.question: Write the second-degree Taylor polynomial for f′ about 4 and use it to approximate f′(4.3).
